description: Borrowed from Old French lection, from Latin lēctiōnem, form of lēctiō, from legō (“I read, I gather”). Doublet of lesson.

entries.meaning: (ecclesiastical) A reading of a religious text; a lesson to be read in church etc.
examples: This man  […]  came to dwell in our city, and here founded this holy house, and he hath edified us by his litanies and his lections of the Koran.
